definition: -ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct
board/plank/plate/shutter/table tennis bat/clappers (music)/CL:塊|块[kuai4]/accented beat in Chinese music/hard/stiff/to stop smiling or look serious

sentences.english: Decoration, the Xiaodongdong have found the floor borers .
sentences.chinese: 裝修後，發現地板上的小洞洞有蛀蟲。

sentences.english: They counterchanged the floor in the bedroom with several colours.
sentences.chinese: 他們把臥室的地板鋪成交錯的顏色。

sentences.english: People are clapping, slapping their thighs, stomping the floor.
sentences.chinese: 人們鼓掌，拍着大腿，跺着地板。

sentences.english: The encyclopedia thudded onto the floor.
sentences.chinese: 那本百科全書砰地掉在地板上。

sentences.english: We put the newspapers in neat piles on the floor.
sentences.chinese: 我們在地板上把報紙整齊地疊起來。

sentences.english: I pull him off the dance floor and ask, what is it about Kizomba.
sentences.chinese: 我把他從地板上拉過來，問他關於基宗巴舞的情況。

sentences.english: She dashed a vase to the floor.
sentences.chinese: 她把花瓶猛擲在地板上。

sentences.english: It was getting late, and the floor was still a mess.
sentences.chinese: 時候不早了，而地板上還是一團糟。

sentences.english: First, the bottom side of the hole in the wall, skirting board in preparation for the installation of the floor.
sentences.chinese: 首先在牆面底側鑽孔，爲安裝地板踢腳線做準備。

sentences.english: The gastrocnemius and soleus press the sole of the foot into the floor.
sentences.chinese: 腓腸肌和比目魚肌將腳底壓向地板。

sentences.english: Feet flat on the floor or footrest.
sentences.chinese: 雙腳平放在地板或者腳墊上。

sentences.english: Start by lying on the floor, with your hands by your sides.
sentences.chinese: 仰臥於地板上，把雙手放在身體兩側。

sentences.english: However if you want you can also opt for a floor heating system.
sentences.chinese: 但是如果你想你還可以選擇地板採暖系統。

sentences.english: Lie face down on the floor with your elbows bent and your palms next to your shoulders.
sentences.chinese: 臉朝地板向下，肘關節彎曲，手心靠近肩膀。

sentences.english: Use under the new wooden floor.

definition: sofa (loanword)/CL:條|条[tiao2],張|张[zhang1]/(Internet slang) the first reply or replier to a forum post
chamber pot/wooden pan used as toilet/toilet bowl
cupboard/cupboard that can also be used as a table/sideboard
